intro: Paracynoglossum glochidiatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions of Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
